post_message: Gabriel Fernandez parents allegedly beat him to death after dousing the little boy with pepper spray, forcing him to eat his own vomit and locking him in a cabinet with a sock stuffed in his mouth, according to court records. Now, the Department of Children and Family Services supervisor who was fired after it was determined he missed opportunities to save the 8-year-old Palmdale boy is close to getting his job back. Gregory Merritt was among those who decided to close Gabriel case shortly before his death even though he knew the boy had written a suicide note and had a BB gun pellet embedded in his chest. A civil service panel recently voted unanimously to reinstate Merritt, imposing a 30-day suspension in lieu of termination, the L.A. Times reported. Read KTLA story here: @webpagelink
